content: Senate Finance Committee Chairman Max Baucus questioned Wednesday whether the proposal was viable, a day after his House counterpart also expressed reservations. President Obama's proposal to limit itemized tax deductions for high earners is running into opposition from key Democrats in Congress who worry that charities and the housing market would be hurt. +++http://www.foxnews.com/politics/2009/03/04/treasury-secretary-defends-tax-hikes-wealthy/ ------------------------------------------------ It just dawned on Congressional Democrats that THEY make more than $250,000 per year.....if they don't cheat on their taxes. "Charities and the housing market would be hurt!" How nobel! So be prepared for a massive tax increase for middle America!

title: Some Democrats Resist Obama Tax Hike on Wealthy
